etymologies: late 19th century: from German, from Greek planktos ‘wandering’, from the base of plazein ‘wander’

definitions: the small and microscopic organisms drifting or floating in the sea or fresh water, consisting chiefly of diatoms, protozoans, small crustaceans, and the eggs and larval stages of larger animals. Many animals are adapted to feed on plankton, especially by filtering the water

examples.text: prawns change their diet from plant plankton to animal plankton

shortDefinitions: small and microscopic organisms drifting or floating in sea or fresh water
